1.verse: Parashah 24: Vayikra (He called) 1:1–5:26(6:7) - ADONAI called to Moshe and spoke to him from the tent of meeting. He said,

2.verse: “Speak to the people of Isra’el; say to them, ‘When any of you brings an offering to ADONAI, you may bring your animal offering either from the herd or from the flock.

3.verse: If his offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he must offer a male without defect. He is to bring it to the entrance of the tent of meeting, so that it can be accepted by ADONAI.

4.verse: He is to lay his hand upon the head of the burnt offering, and it will be accepted on his behalf to make atonement for him.

5.verse: He is to slaughter the young bull before ADONAI ; and the sons of Aharon, the cohanim, are to present the blood. They are to splash the blood against all sides of the altar, which is by the entrance to the tent of meeting.

6.verse: He is to skin the burnt offering and cut it in pieces.

7.verse: The descendants of Aharon the cohen are to put fire on the altar and arrange wood on the fire.

8.verse: The sons of Aharon, the cohanim, are to arrange the pieces, the head and the fat on the wood which is on the fire on the altar.

9.verse: He is to wash the entrails and lower parts of the legs with water, and the cohen is to cause all of it to go up in smoke on the altar as a burnt offering; it is an offering made by fire, a fragrant aroma for ADONAI.

10.verse: “‘If his offering is from the flock, whether from the sheep or from the goats, for a burnt offering, he must offer a male without defect.

11.verse: He is to slaughter it on the north side of the altar before ADONAI; and the sons of Aharon, the cohanim, are to splash its blood against all sides of the altar.

12.verse: He is to cut it into pieces, and the cohen is to arrange them with the head and fat on the wood which is on the fire on the altar.

13.verse: He is to wash the entrails and lower parts of the legs with water; and the cohen is to offer it all and make it go up in smoke on the altar as a burnt offering; it is an offering made by fire, a fragrant aroma for ADONAI.

14.verse: (ii) “‘If his offering to ADONAI is a burnt offering of birds, he must offer a dove or a young pigeon.

15.verse: The cohen is to bring it to the altar, snap off its head and make it go up in smoke on the altar; its blood is to be drained out on the side of the altar.

16.verse: He is to remove the food pouch and its feathers from its neck and discard it on the pile of ashes just east of the altar.

17.verse: He is to pull it open with a wing on each side, but without tearing it in half. The cohen is to make it go up in smoke on the altar, on the wood which is on the fire, as a burnt offering; it is an offering made by fire, a fragrant aroma for ADONAI.

1.verse: “‘Anyone who brings a grain offering to ADONAI is to make his offering of fine flour; he is to pour olive oil on it and put frankincense on it.

2.verse: He is to bring it to the sons of Aharon, the cohanim. The cohen is to take a handful of fine flour from it, together with its olive oil and all its frankincense, and make this reminder portion go up in smoke on the altar as an offering made by fire, a fragrant aroma for ADONAI.

3.verse: But the rest of the grain offering will belong to Aharon and his sons; it is an especially holy part of the offerings for ADONAI made by fire.

4.verse: “‘When you bring a grain offering which has been baked in the oven, it is to consist of either unleavened cakes made of fine flour mixed with olive oil or matzah spread with olive oil.

5.verse: If your offering is a grain offering cooked on a griddle, it is to consist of unleavened fine flour mixed with olive oil;

6.verse: you are to break it in pieces and pour olive oil on it — it is a grain offering.

7.verse: (iii) If your offering is a grain offering cooked in a pot, it is to consist of fine flour with olive oil.

8.verse: “‘You are to bring the grain offering prepared in any of these ways to ADONAI ; it is to be presented to the cohen, and he is to bring it to the altar.

9.verse: The cohen is to remove the reminder portion of the grain offering and make it go up in smoke on the altar as an offering made by fire, a fragrant aroma for ADONAI.

10.verse: But the rest of the grain offering will belong to Aharon and his sons; it is an especially holy part of the offerings for ADONAI made by fire.

11.verse: “‘No grain offering that you bring to ADONAI is to be made with leaven, because you are not to cause any leaven or honey to go up in smoke as an offering made by fire to ADONAI.

12.verse: As an offering of firstfruits you may bring these to ADONAI, but they are not to be brought up onto the altar to make a fragrant aroma.

13.verse: You are to season every grain offering of yours with salt — do not omit from your grain offering the salt of the covenant with your God, but offer salt with all your offerings.

14.verse: “‘If you bring a grain offering of firstfruits to ADONAI, you are to bring as the grain offering from your firstfruits kernels of grain from fresh ears, dry-roasted with fire.

15.verse: Put olive oil on it, and lay frankincense on it; it is a grain offering.

16.verse: The cohen is to cause the reminder portion of it, its grits and olive oil, with all its frankincense, to go up in smoke; it is an offering made by fire for ADONAI.

1.verse: (iv) “‘If his offering is a sacrifice of peace offerings, then, if he offers before ADONAI an animal from the herd, then, no matter whether it is male or female, it must be without defect.

2.verse: He is to lay his hand on the head of his offering and slaughter it at the entrance to the tent of meeting; and the sons of Aharon, the cohanim, are to splash the blood against all sides of the altar.

3.verse: He is to present the sacrifice of the peace offerings as an offering made by fire to ADONAI; it is to consist of the fat covering the inner organs, all the fat above the inner organs,

4.verse: the two kidneys, the fat on them near the flanks, and the covering of the liver, which he will remove with the kidneys.

5.verse: Aharon’s sons will make it go up in smoke on the altar on top of the burnt offering which is on the wood on the fire; it is an offering made by fire, a fragrant aroma for ADONAI.

6.verse: “‘If his offering for a sacrifice of peace offerings to ADONAI is from the flock, then, when he offers it, no matter whether it is male or female, it must be without defect.

7.verse: If he brings a lamb for his offering, then he is to present it before ADONAI.

8.verse: He is to lay his hand on the head of his offering and slaughter it at the entrance to the tent of meeting, and the sons of Aharon are to splash its blood against all sides of the altar.

9.verse: From the sacrifices made as peace offerings, he is to present ADONAI with an offering made by fire; it is to consist of its fat, the entire fat tail, which he will remove close to the lower backbone, the fat covering the inner organs, all the fat above the inner organs,

10.verse: the two kidneys, the fat on them near the flanks, and the covering of the liver, which he will remove with the kidneys.

11.verse: The cohen will make it go up in smoke on the altar; it is food, an offering made by fire to ADONAI.

12.verse: “‘If his offering is a goat, then he is to present it before ADONAI.

13.verse: He is to lay his hand on its head and slaughter it in front of the tent of meeting, and the sons of Aharon are to splash its blood against all sides of the altar.

14.verse: He is to present from it his offering, an offering made by fire to ADONAI ; it is to consist of the fat covering the inner organs, all the fat above the inner organs,

15.verse: the two kidneys, the fat on them near the flanks, and the covering of the liver, which he will remove with the kidneys.

16.verse: The cohen will make them go up in smoke on the altar; it is food, an offering made by fire to be a fragrant aroma; all the fat belongs to ADONAI.

17.verse: It is to be a permanent regulation through all your generations wherever you live that you will eat neither fat nor blood.’”

1.verse: (v) ADONAI said to Moshe,

2.verse: “Tell the people of Isra’el: ‘If anyone sins inadvertently against any of the mitzvot of ADONAI concerning things which should not be done, if he does any one of them,

3.verse: then, if it is the anointed cohen who sinned and thus brought guilt on the people, he is to offer ADONAI a young bull without defect as a sin offering for the sin he committed.

4.verse: He must bring the bull to the entrance of the tent of meeting before ADONAI, lay his hand on the bull’s head and slaughter the bull in the presence of ADONAI.

5.verse: The anointed cohen is to take some of the bull’s blood and bring it to the tent of meeting.

6.verse: The cohen is to dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle some of the blood seven times in the presence of ADONAI in front of the curtain of the sanctuary.

7.verse: The cohen is to put some of the blood on the horns of the altar for fragrant incense before ADONAI there in the tent of meeting. All the remaining blood of the bull he is to pour out at the base of the altar for burnt offerings, which is at the entrance to the tent of meeting.

8.verse: He is to remove from the bull for the sin offering all of its fat — the fat covering the inner organs, all the fat above the inner organs,

9.verse: the two kidneys, the fat on them near the flanks, and the covering of the liver, which he will remove with the kidneys

10.verse: as it is removed from an ox sacrificed as a peace offering; and the cohen is to make these parts go up in smoke on the altar for burnt offerings.

11.verse: But the bull’s hide and all its flesh, with its head, the lower parts of its legs, its inner organs and dung —

12.verse: in other words, the entire bull — he is to bring outside the camp to a clean place, where the ashes are emptied out. There he is to burn it on wood with fire; there, where the ashes are emptied out, it is to be burned up.

13.verse: “‘If the entire community of Isra’el inadvertently makes a mistake, with the assembly being unaware of the matter, and they do something against any of the mitzvot of ADONAI concerning things which should not be done, they are guilty.

14.verse: When the sin they have committed becomes known, then the assembly is to offer a young bull as a sin offering and bring it before the tent of meeting.

15.verse: The leaders of the community are to lay their hands on the bull’s head and slaughter the bull in the presence of ADONAI.

16.verse: The anointed cohen is to bring some of the bull’s blood to the tent of meeting.

17.verse: The cohen is to dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle it seven times in the presence of ADONAI in front of the curtain.

18.verse: He is to put some of the blood on the horns of the altar before ADONAI, there in the tent of meeting. All the remaining blood he is to pour out at the base of the altar for burnt offerings, which is at the entrance to the tent of meeting.

19.verse: He is to remove all its fat and make it go up in smoke on the altar.

20.verse: This is what he is to do with the bull — he must do the same with this bull as he does with the one for the sin offering. Thus the cohen will make atonement for them, and they will be forgiven.

21.verse: He is to bring the bull outside the camp and burn it as he burned the first bull; it is the sin offering for the assembly.

22.verse: “‘When a leader sins and inadvertently does something against any of the mitzvot of ADONAI concerning things which should not be done, he is guilty.

23.verse: If the sin which he committed becomes known to him, he is to bring as his offering a male goat without defect,

24.verse: lay his hand on the goat’s head and slaughter it in the place where they slaughter the burnt offering in the presence of ADONAI ; it is a sin offering.

25.verse: The cohen is to take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar for burnt offerings. Its remaining blood he is to pour out at the base of the altar for burnt offerings.

26.verse: All its fat he is to make go up in smoke on the altar, like the fat of the sacrifice for peace offerings; thus the cohen will make atonement for him in regard to his sin, and he will be forgiven.

27.verse: (vi) “‘If an individual among the people commits a sin inadvertently, doing something against any of the mitzvot of ADONAI concerning things which should not be done, he is guilty.

28.verse: If the sin he committed becomes known to him, he is to bring as his offering a female goat without defect for the sin he committed,

29.verse: lay his hand on the head of the sin offering and slaughter the sin offering in the place of burnt offerings.

30.verse: The cohen is to take some of its blood with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar for burnt offerings. All its remaining blood he is to pour out at the base of the altar.

31.verse: All its fat he is to remove, as the fat is removed from the sacrifice for peace offerings; and the cohen is to make it go up in smoke on the altar as a fragrant aroma for ADONAI. Thus the cohen will make atonement for him, and he will be forgiven.

32.verse: “‘If he brings a lamb as his sin offering, he is to bring a female without defect,

33.verse: lay his hand on the head of the sin offering and slaughter it as a sin offering in the place where they slaughter burnt offerings.

34.verse: The cohen is to take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar for burnt offerings. All its remaining blood he is to pour out at the base of the altar.

35.verse: All its fat he is to remove, as the fat of a lamb is removed from the sacrifice for peace offerings; and the cohen is to make it go up in smoke on the altar on top of the offerings for ADONAI made by fire. Thus the cohen will make atonement for him in regard to the sin he committed, and he will be forgiven.

1.verse: “‘If a person who is a witness, sworn to testify, sins by refusing to tell what he has seen or heard about the matter, he must bear the consequences.

2.verse: If a person touches something unclean, whether the carcass of an unclean wild animal, a domestic animal or a reptile, he is guilty, even though he may not be aware that he is unclean.

3.verse: If he touches some human uncleanness, no matter what the source of his uncleanness is, and is unaware of it, then, when he learns of it, he is guilty.

4.verse: If someone allows to slip from his mouth an oath to do evil or to do good, and he doesn’t remember that he clearly spoke this oath, then, no matter what it was about, when he learns of it, he is guilty.

5.verse: A person guilty of any of these things is to confess in what manner he sinned

6.verse: and bring his guilt offering to ADONAI for the sin he committed; it is to be a female from the flock, either a lamb or a goat, as a sin offering; and the cohen will make atonement for him in regard to his sin.

7.verse: “‘If he can’t afford a lamb, he is to bring as his guilt offering for the sin he committed two doves or two young pigeons for ADONAI — the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering.

8.verse: He is to bring them to the cohen, who will offer the one for a sin offering first. He is to wring its neck but not remove the head,

9.verse: sprinkle some of the blood of the sin offering on the side of the altar and drain out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar; it is a sin offering.

10.verse: He is to prepare the second as a burnt offering in the manner prescribed. Thus the cohen will make atonement for him in regard to the sin which he committed, and he will be forgiven.

11.verse: (vii) “‘But if his means are insufficient even for two doves or two young pigeons, then he is to bring as his offering for the sin he committed two quarts of fine flour for a sin offering; he is not to put any olive oil or frankincense on it, because it is a sin offering.

12.verse: He is to bring it to the cohen, and the cohen is to take a handful of it as its reminder portion and make it go up in smoke on the altar on top of the offerings for ADONAI made by fire; it is a sin offering.

13.verse: Thus the cohen will make atonement for him in regard to the sin he committed concerning any of these things, and he will be forgiven. The rest will belong to the cohanim, as with a grain offering.’”

14.verse: ADONAI said to Moshe,

15.verse: “If anyone acts improperly and inadvertently sins in regard to the holy things of ADONAI, he is to bring as his guilt offering for ADONAI a ram without defect from the flock or its equivalent in silver shekels (using the sanctuary shekel as the standard), according to your appraisal of its value; it is a guilt offering.

16.verse: In addition, he is to make restitution for whatever he did wrong in regard to the holy thing; moreover, he is to add to that one-fifth and give it to the cohen. Then the cohen will make atonement with the ram of the guilt offering, and he will be forgiven.

17.verse: “If someone sins by doing something against any of the mitzvot of ADONAI concerning things which should not be done, he is guilty, even if he is unaware of it; and he bears the consequences of his wrongdoing.

18.verse: He must bring a ram without defect from the flock, or its equivalent according to your appraisal, to the cohen for a guilt offering; the cohen will make atonement concerning the error which he committed, even though he was unaware of it; and he will be forgiven.

19.verse: It is a guilt offering — he is certainly guilty before ADONAI.”

1.verse: Parashah 25: Tzav (Give an order) 6:1(8) – 8:36 - ADONAI said to Moshe,

2.verse: “Give this order to Aharon and his sons: ‘This is the law for the burnt offering : it is what goes up on its firewood upon the altar all night long, until morning; in this way the fire of the altar will be kept burning.

3.verse: When the fire has consumed the burnt offering on the altar, the cohen, having put on his linen garment and covered himself with his linen shorts, is to remove the ashes and put them beside the altar.

4.verse: Then he is to remove those garments and put on others, before carrying the ashes outside the camp to a clean place.

5.verse: In this way, the fire on the altar will be kept burning and not be allowed to go out. Each morning, the cohen is to kindle wood on it, arrange the burnt offering and make the fat of the peace offerings go up in smoke.

6.verse: Fire is to be kept burning on the altar continually; it is not to go out.

7.verse: “‘This is the law for the grain offering: the sons of Aharon are to offer it before ADONAI in front of the altar.

8.verse: He is to take from the grain offering a handful of its fine flour, some of its olive oil and all of the frankincense which is on the grain offering; and he is to make this reminder portion of it go up in smoke on the altar as a fragrant aroma for ADONAI.

9.verse: The rest of it Aharon and his sons are to eat; it is to be eaten without leaven in a holy place — they are to eat it in the courtyard of the tent of meeting.

10.verse: It is not to be baked with leaven. I have given it as their portion of my offerings made by fire; like the sin offering and the guilt offering, it is especially holy.

11.verse: Every male descendant of Aharon may eat from it; it is his share of the offerings for ADONAI made by fire forever through all your generations. Whatever touches those offerings will become holy.’”

12.verse: (ii) ADONAI said to Moshe,

13.verse: “This is the offering for ADONAI that Aharon and his sons are to offer on the day he is anointed: two quarts of fine flour, half of it in the morning and half in the evening, as a grain offering from then on.

14.verse: It is to be well mixed with olive oil and fried on a griddle; then bring it in, break it in pieces and offer the grain offering as a fragrant aroma for ADONAI.

15.verse: The anointed cohen who will take Aharon’s place from among his descendants will offer it; it is a perpetual obligation. It must be entirely made to go up in smoke for ADONAI;

16.verse: every grain offering of the cohen is to be entirely made to go up in smoke — it is not to be eaten.”

17.verse: ADONAI said to Moshe,

18.verse: “Tell Aharon and his sons, ‘This is the law for the sin offering: the sin offering is to be slaughtered before ADONAI in the place where the burnt offering is slaughtered; it is especially holy.

19.verse: The cohen who offers it for sin is to eat it — it is to be eaten in a holy place, in the courtyard of the tent of meeting.

20.verse: Whatever touches its flesh will become holy; if any of its blood splashes on any item of clothing, you are to wash it in a holy place.

21.verse: The clay pot in which it is cooked must be broken; if it is cooked in a bronze pot, it must be scoured and rinsed in water.

22.verse: Any male from a family of cohanim may eat the sin offering; it is especially holy.

23.verse: But no sin offering which has had any of its blood brought into the tent of meeting to make atonement in the Holy Place is to be eaten; it is to be burned up completely.

1.verse: “‘This is the law for the guilt offering: it is especially holy.

2.verse: They are to slaughter the guilt offering in the place where they slaughter the burnt offering, and its blood is to be splashed against all sides of the altar.

3.verse: He is to offer all its fat — the fat tail, the fat covering the inner organs,

4.verse: the two kidneys, the fat on them near the flanks, and the covering of the liver, which he will remove with the kidneys.

5.verse: The cohen will make them go up in smoke on the altar as an offering made by fire to ADONAI ; it is a guilt offering.

6.verse: Every male from a family of cohanim may eat it; it is to be eaten in a holy place; it is especially holy.

7.verse: The guilt offering is like the sin offering; the same law governs them — it will belong to the cohen who uses it to make atonement.

8.verse: “‘The cohen who offers someone’s burnt offering will possess the hide of the burnt offering which he has offered.

9.verse: “‘Every grain offering baked in the oven, cooked in a pot or fried on a griddle will belong to the cohen who offers it.

10.verse: But every grain offering which is mixed with olive oil or is dry will belong to all the sons of Aharon equally.

11.verse: (iii) “‘This is the law for sacrificing peace offerings offered to ADONAI:

12.verse: If a person offers it for giving thanks, he is to offer it with the thanksgiving sacrifice of unleavened cakes mixed with olive oil, matzah spread with olive oil, and cakes made of fine flour mixed with olive oil and fried.

13.verse: With cakes of leavened bread he is to present his offering together with the sacrifice of his peace offerings for giving thanks.

14.verse: From each kind of offering he is to present one as a gift for ADONAI; it will belong to the cohen who splashes the blood of the peace offerings against the altar.

15.verse: The meat of the sacrifice of his peace offerings for giving thanks is to be eaten on the day of his offering; he is not to leave any of it until morning.

16.verse: But if the sacrifice connected with his offering is for a vow or is a voluntary offering, then, while it is to be eaten on the day he offers his sacrifice, what remains of it may be eaten the next day.

17.verse: However, what remains of the meat of the sacrifice on the third day is to be burned up completely.

18.verse: If any of the meat of the sacrifice of his peace offerings is eaten on the third day, the sacrifice will neither be accepted nor credited to the person offering it; rather, it will have become a disgusting thing, and whoever eats it will bear the consequences of his wrongdoing.

19.verse: Meat which touches something unclean is not to be eaten but burned up completely. As for the meat, everyone who is clean may eat it;

20.verse: but a person in a state of uncleanness who eats any meat from the sacrifice of peace offerings made to ADONAI will be cut off from his people.

21.verse: Anyone who touches something unclean — whether the uncleanness be from a person, from an unclean animal or from some other unclean detestable thing — and then eats the meat from the sacrifice of peace offerings for ADONAI, that person will be cut off from his people.’”

22.verse: ADONAI said to Moshe,

23.verse: “Say to the people of Isra’el, ‘You are not to eat the fat of bulls, sheep or goats.

24.verse: The fat of animals that die of themselves or are killed by wild animals may be used for any other purpose, but under no circumstances are you to eat it.

25.verse: For whoever eats the fat of animals of the kind used in presenting an offering made by fire to ADONAI will be cut off from his people.

26.verse: You are not to eat any kind of blood, whether from birds or animals, in any of your homes.

27.verse: Whoever eats any blood will be cut off from his people.’”

29.verse: “Say to the people of Isra’el, ‘A person who offers his sacrifice of peace offerings to ADONAI is to bring part of his sacrifice of peace offerings as his offering for ADONAI.

30.verse: He is to bring with his own hands the offerings for ADONAI made by fire — he is to bring the breast with its fat. The breast is to be waved as a wave offering before ADONAI.

31.verse: The cohen is to make the fat go up in smoke on the altar, but the breast will belong to Aharon and his descendants.

32.verse: You are to give the right thigh from your sacrifices of peace offerings to the cohen as a contribution.

33.verse: The descendant of Aharon who offers the blood of the peace offerings is to have the right thigh as his share.

34.verse: For the breast that has been waved and the thigh that has been contributed I have taken from the people of Isra’el out of their sacrifices of peace offerings and given them to Aharon the cohen and to his descendants as their share forever from the people of Isra’el.’”

35.verse: On the day when Aharon and his sons were presented to serve ADONAI in the office of cohen, this portion was set aside for him and his descendants from the offerings for ADONAI made by fire.

36.verse: On the day they were anointed, ADONAI ordered that this be given to them by the people of Isra’el. It is their share forever through all their generations.

37.verse: This is the law for the burnt offering, the grain offering, the sin offering, the guilt offering, the consecration offering and the sacrifice of peace offerings

38.verse: which ADONAI ordered Moshe on Mount Sinai on the day he ordered the people of Isra’el to present their offerings to ADONAI, in the Sinai Desert.

1.verse: (iv) ADONAI said to Moshe,

2.verse: “Take Aharon and his sons with him, the garments, the anointing oil, the bull for the sin offering, the two rams and the basket of matzah;

3.verse: and assemble the entire community at the entrance to the tent of meeting.”

4.verse: Moshe did as ADONAI ordered him, and the community was assembled at the entrance to the tent of meeting.

5.verse: Moshe said to the community, “This is what ADONAI has ordered to be done.”

6.verse: Moshe brought Aharon and his sons, washed them with water,

7.verse: put the tunic on him, wrapped the sash around him, clothed him with the robe, put the ritual vest on him, wrapped around him the decorated belt and fastened the vest to him with it.

8.verse: He put the breastplate on him, and on the breastplate he put the urim and tumim.

9.verse: He set the turban on his head, and on the front of the turban he affixed the gold plate, the holy ornament, as ADONAI had ordered Moshe.

10.verse: Then Moshe took the anointing oil and anointed the tabernacle and everything in it, thus consecrating them.

11.verse: He sprinkled some on the altar seven times, anointing the altar with all its utensils and the basin with its base, to consecrate them.

12.verse: He poured some of the anointing oil on Aharon’s head and anointed him, to consecrate him.

13.verse: Moshe brought Aharon’s sons, clothed them with tunics, wrapped sashes on them and put headgear on them, as ADONAI had ordered Moshe.

14.verse: (v) Then the young bull for the sin offering was brought, and Aharon and his sons laid their hands on the head of the bull for the sin offering.

15.verse: After it had been slaughtered, Moshe took the blood and put it on the horns of the altar all the way around with his finger, thus purifying the altar. The remaining blood he poured out at the base of the altar and consecrated it, to make atonement for it.

16.verse: Moshe took all the fat on the inner organs, the covering of the liver, the two kidneys and their fat, and made it go up in smoke on the altar.

17.verse: But the bull, its hide, its flesh and its dung were taken outside the camp and burned up completely, as ADONAI had ordered Moshe.

18.verse: Next, the ram for the burnt offering was presented. Aharon and his sons laid their hands on the head of the ram;

19.verse: and after it had been slaughtered, Moshe splashed the blood on all sides of the altar.

20.verse: When the ram had been cut in pieces, Moshe made the head, the pieces and the fat go up in smoke.

21.verse: When the inner organs and the lower parts of the legs had been washed with water, Moshe made the entire ram go up in smoke on the altar; it was a burnt offering giving a fragrant aroma, an offering made by fire to ADONAI — as ADONAI had ordered Moshe.

22.verse: (vi) Then the other ram was presented, the ram of consecration; Aharon and his sons laid their hands on the head of the ram.

23.verse: After it had been slaughtered, Moshe took some of its blood and put it on the tip of Aharon’s right ear, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.

24.verse: Next Aharon’s sons were brought, and Moshe put some of the blood on the tips of their right ears, on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet; then Moshe splashed the blood on all sides of the altar.

25.verse: He took the fat, the fat tail, all the fat covering the inner organs, the covering of the liver, the two kidneys with their fat, and the right thigh.

26.verse: From the basket of matzah that was before ADONAI he took one piece of matzah, one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer, and placed them on the fat and on the right thigh.

27.verse: Then he put it all in Aharon’s hands and in the hands of his sons and waved them as a wave offering before ADONAI.

28.verse: Moshe took them out of their hands and made them go up in smoke on the altar on top of the burnt offering; they were a consecration offering giving a fragrant aroma; an offering made by fire to ADONAI.

29.verse: Moshe took the breast and waved it as a wave offering before ADONAI; it was Moshe’s portion of the ram of consecration — as ADONAI had ordered Moshe.

30.verse: (vii) Moshe took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood which was on the altar and sprinkled it on Aharon and his clothing, and on his sons with him and their clothing, and consecrated Aharon and his clothing together with his sons and their clothing.

31.verse: Moshe said to Aharon and his sons, “Boil the meat at the door of the tent of meeting; and eat it there with the bread that is in the basket of consecration, as I ordered when I said that Aharon and his sons are to eat it.

32.verse: Whatever is left over of the meat and bread you are to burn up completely.

33.verse: (Maftir) You are not to go out from the entrance to the tent of meeting for seven days, until the days of your consecration are over; since ADONAI will be consecrating you for seven days.

34.verse: He ordered done what has been done today, in order to make atonement for you.

35.verse: You are to remain at the entrance to the tent of meeting day and night for seven days, thereby obeying what ADONAI ordered done, so that you may not die. For this is what I was ordered.”

36.verse: Aharon and his sons did all the things which ADONAI ordered through Moshe. Haftarah Tzav: Yirmeyahu (Jeremiah) 7:21–8:3; 9:22(23)–23(24) Suggested readings for Parashah Tzav from the B’rit Hadashah: Mark 12:28–34; Romans 12:1–2; 1 Corinthians 10:14–23

1.verse: Parashah 26: Sh’mini (Eighth) 9:1–11:47 - On the eighth day, Moshe called Aharon, his sons and the leaders of Isra’el,

2.verse: and said to Aharon, “Take a male calf for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering, both without defect, and offer them before ADONAI.

3.verse: Then tell the people of Isra’el, ‘Take a male goat for a sin offering and a calf and a lamb, both a year old and without defect, for a burnt offering,

4.verse: and an ox and a ram for peace offerings, to sacrifice before ADONAI; also a grain offering mixed with olive oil — because today ADONAI is going to appear to you.’”

5.verse: They brought what Moshe had ordered before the tent of meeting, and the whole community approached and stood before ADONAI.

6.verse: Moshe said, “This is what ADONAI has ordered you to do, so that the glory of ADONAI will appear to you.”

7.verse: Moshe told Aharon, “Approach the altar, offer your sin offering and burnt offering, and make atonement for yourself and the people. Then present the offering of the people and make atonement for them, as ADONAI ordered.”

8.verse: So Aharon approached the altar and slaughtered the calf of the sin offering which was for himself.

9.verse: The sons of Aharon presented the blood to him; and he dipped his finger in the blood and put it on the horns of the altar; then he poured out the blood at the base of the altar.

10.verse: But the fat, the kidneys and the covering of the liver of the sin offering he made go up in smoke on the altar, as ADONAI had ordered Moshe.

11.verse: The meat and the skin were burned up completely outside the camp.

12.verse: Next he slaughtered the burnt offering; Aharon’s sons brought him the blood, and he splashed it against all sides of the altar.

13.verse: They brought him the burnt offering, piece by piece, and the head; and he made them go up in smoke on the altar.

14.verse: He washed the inner organs and the lower parts of the legs and made them go up in smoke on top of the burnt offering on the altar.

15.verse: Then the people’s offering was presented. He took the goat of the sin offering which was for the people, slaughtered it and offered it for sin, like the earlier sin offering.

16.verse: The burnt offering was presented, and he offered it in the prescribed manner.

17.verse: (ii) The grain offering was presented; he took a handful of it and made it go up in smoke on the altar, in addition to the morning’s burnt offering.

18.verse: He slaughtered the ox and the ram, the people’s sacrifice as peace offerings; Aharon’s sons brought him the blood, which he splashed against all sides of the altar,

19.verse: and the fat of the ox and of the ram — the fat tail, the fat which covers the inner organs, the kidneys and the covering of the liver.

20.verse: They put the fat on the breasts, and he made the fat go up in smoke on the altar.

21.verse: The breasts and right thigh Aharon waved as a wave offering before ADONAI, as Moshe had ordered.

22.verse: Aharon raised his hands toward the people, blessed them and came down from offering the sin offering, the burnt offering and the peace offerings.

23.verse: Moshe and Aharon entered the tent of meeting, came out and blessed the people. Then the glory of ADONAI appeared to all the people!

24.verse: (iii) Fire came forth from the presence of ADONAI, consuming the burnt offering and the fat on the altar. When all the people saw it, they shouted and fell on their faces.

1.verse: But Nadav and Avihu, sons of Aharon, each took his censer, put fire in it, laid incense on it, and offered unauthorized fire before ADONAI, something he had not ordered them to do.

2.verse: At this, fire came forth from the presence of ADONAI and consumed them, so that they died in the presence of ADONAI.

3.verse: Moshe said to Aharon, “This is what ADONAI said: ‘Through those who are near me I will be consecrated, and before all the people I will be glorified.’” Aharon kept silent.

4.verse: Moshe called Misha’el and Eltzafan, sons of ‘Uzi’el Aharon’s uncle, and told them, “Come here, and carry your cousins away from in front of the sanctuary to a place outside the camp.”

5.verse: They approached and carried them in their tunics out of the camp, as Moshe had said.

6.verse: Then Moshe told Aharon and his sons El‘azar and Itamar, “Don’t unbind your hair or tear your clothes in mourning, so that you won’t die and so that ADONAI won’t be angry with the entire community. Rather, let your kinsmen — the whole house of Isra’el — mourn, because of the destruction ADONAI brought about with his fire.

7.verse: Moreover, don’t leave the entrance to the tent of meeting, or you will die, because ADONAI’s anointing oil is on you.”

8.verse: ADONAI said to Aharon,

9.verse: “Don’t drink any wine or other intoxicating liquor, neither you nor your sons with you, when you enter the tent of meeting, so that you will not die. This is to be a permanent regulation through all your generations,

10.verse: so that you will distinguish between the holy and the common, and between the unclean and the clean;

11.verse: and so that you will teach the people of Isra’el all the laws ADONAI has told them through Moshe.”

12.verse: (iv) Moshe said to Aharon and to El‘azar and Itamar, his remaining sons, “Take the grain offering left from the offerings for ADONAI made by fire, and eat it without leaven next to the altar, because it is especially holy.

13.verse: Eat it in a holy place, because it is your and your sons’ share of the offerings for ADONAI made by fire; for this is what I have been ordered.

14.verse: The breast that was waved and the thigh that was raised you are to eat in a clean place — you, your sons and your daughters with you; for these are given as your and your children’s share of the sacrifices of the peace offerings presented by the people of Isra’el.

15.verse: They are to bring the raised thigh and the waved breast, along with the offerings of fat made by fire, and wave it as a wave offering before ADONAI; then it will belong to you and your descendants with you as your perpetual share, as ADONAI has ordered.”

16.verse: (v) Then Moshe carefully investigated what had happened to the goat of the sin offering and discovered that it had been burned up. He became angry with El‘azar and Itamar, the remaining sons of Aharon, and asked,

17.verse: “Why didn’t you eat the sin offering in the area of the sanctuary, since it is especially holy? He gave it to you to take away the guilt of the community, to make atonement for them before ADONAI.

18.verse: Look! Its blood wasn’t brought into the sanctuary! You should have eaten it there in the sanctuary, as I ordered.”

19.verse: Aharon answered Moshe, “Even though they offered their sin offering and burnt offering today, things like these have happened to me! If I had eaten the sin offering today, would it have pleased ADONAI?”

20.verse: On hearing this reply, Moshe was satisfied.

1.verse: (vi) ADONAI said to Moshe and Aharon,

2.verse: “Tell the people of Isra’el, ‘These are the living creatures which you may eat among all the land animals:

3.verse: any that has a separate hoof which is completely divided and chews the cud — these animals you may eat.

4.verse: But you are not to eat those that only chew the cud or only have a separate hoof. For example, the camel, the coney and the hare are unclean for you, because they chew the cud but don’t have a separate hoof;

5.verse: But you are not to eat those that only chew the cud or only have a separate hoof. For example, the camel, the coney and the hare are unclean for you, because they chew the cud but don’t have a separate hoof;

6.verse: But you are not to eat those that only chew the cud or only have a separate hoof. For example, the camel, the coney and the hare are unclean for you, because they chew the cud but don’t have a separate hoof;

7.verse: while the pig is unclean for you, because, although it has a separate and completely divided hoof, it doesn’t chew the cud.

8.verse: You are not to eat meat from these or touch their carcasses; they are unclean for you.

9.verse: “‘Of all the things that live in the water, you may eat these: anything in the water that has fins and scales, whether in seas or in rivers — these you may eat.

10.verse: But everything in the seas and rivers without both fins and scales, of all the small water-creatures and of all the living creatures in the water, is a detestable thing for you.

11.verse: Yes, these will be detestable for you — you are not to eat their meat, and you are to detest their carcasses.

12.verse: Whatever lacks fins and scales in the water is a detestable thing for you.

13.verse: “‘The following creatures of the air are to be detestable for you — they are not to be eaten, they are a detestable thing: the eagle, the vulture, the osprey,

14.verse: the kite, the various kinds of buzzards,

15.verse: the various kinds of ravens,

16.verse: the ostrich, the screech-owl, the seagull, the various kinds of hawks,

17.verse: the little owl, the cormorant, the great owl,

18.verse: the horned owl, the pelican, the barn owl,

19.verse: the stork, the various kinds of herons, the hoopoe and the bat.

20.verse: “‘All winged swarming creatures that go on all fours are a detestable thing for you;

21.verse: except that of all winged swarming creatures that go on all fours, you may eat those that have jointed legs above their feet, enabling them to jump off the ground.

22.verse: Specifically, of these you may eat the various kinds of locusts, grasshoppers, katydids and crickets.

23.verse: But other than that, all winged swarming creatures having four feet are a detestable thing for you.

24.verse: “‘The following will make you unclean; whoever touches the carcass of them will be unclean until evening,

25.verse: and whoever picks up any part of their carcass is to wash his clothes and be unclean until evening:

26.verse: every animal that has a separate but incompletely divided hoof or that doesn’t chew the cud is unclean for you; anyone who touches them will become unclean.

27.verse: Whatever goes on its paws, among all animals that go on all fours, is unclean for you; whoever touches its carcass will be unclean until evening;

28.verse: and whoever picks up its carcass is to wash his clothes and be unclean until evening — these are unclean for you.

29.verse: “‘The following are unclean for you among the small creatures that swarm on the ground: the weasel, the mouse, the various kinds of lizards,

30.verse: the gecko, the land crocodile, the skink, the sand-lizard and the chameleon.

31.verse: They are unclean crawling creatures; whoever touches them when they are dead will be unclean until evening.

32.verse: Anything on which one of them falls when dead will become unclean — wooden utensil, article of clothing, leather, sacking — any utensil used for work; it must be put in water, and it will be unclean until evening; then it will be clean.

33.verse: (vii) If one of them falls into a clay pot, whatever is in it will become unclean, and you are to break the pot.

34.verse: Any food permitted to be eaten that water from such a vessel gets on will become unclean, and any permitted liquid in such a vessel will become unclean.

35.verse: Everything on which any carcass-part of theirs falls will become unclean, whether oven or stove; it is to be broken in pieces — they are unclean and will be unclean for you;

36.verse: although a spring or cistern for collecting water remains clean. But anyone who touches one of their carcasses will become unclean.

37.verse: If any carcass-part of theirs falls on any kind of seed to be sown, it is clean;

38.verse: but if water is put on the seed and a carcass-part of theirs falls on it, it is unclean for you.

39.verse: “‘If an animal of a kind that you are permitted to eat dies, whoever touches its carcass will be unclean until evening.

40.verse: A person who eats meat from its carcass or carries its carcass is to wash his clothes; he will be unclean until evening.

41.verse: “‘Any creature that swarms on the ground is a detestable thing; it is not to be eaten —

42.verse: whatever moves on its stomach, goes on all fours, or has many legs — all creatures that swarm on the ground; you are not to eat them, because they are a detestable thing.

43.verse: You are not to make yourselves detestable with any of these swarming, crawling creatures; do not make yourselves unclean with them, do not defile yourselves with them.

44.verse: For I am ADONAI your God; therefore, consecrate yourselves and be holy, for I am holy; and do not defile yourselves with any kind of swarming creature that moves along the ground.

45.verse: (Maftir) For I am ADONAI, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt to be your God. Therefore you are to be holy, because I am holy.

46.verse: “‘Such, then, is the law concerning animals, flying creatures, all living creatures that move about in the water, and all creatures that swarm on the ground.

47.verse: Its purpose is to distinguish between the unclean and the clean, and between the creatures that may be eaten and those that may not be eaten.’” Haftarah Sh’mini: Sh’mu’el Bet (2 Samuel) 6:1–7:17 (A); 6:1–19 (S) Suggested readings for Parashah Sh’mini from the B’rit Hadashah: Mark 7:1–23; Acts 5:1–11; 10:1–35; 2 Corinthians 6:14–7:1; Galatians 2:11–16; 1 Kefa (1 Peter) 1:14–16

1.verse: Parashah 27: Tazria (She conceives) 12:1–13:59 -[In regular years read with Parashah 28, in leap years read separately] ADONAI said to Moshe,

2.verse: “Tell the people of Isra’el: ‘If a woman conceives and gives birth to a boy, she will be unclean for seven days with the same uncleanness as in niddah, when she is having her menstrual period.

3.verse: On the eighth day, the baby’s foreskin is to be circumcised.

4.verse: She is to wait an additional thirty-three days to be purified from her blood; she is not to touch any holy thing or come into the sanctuary until the time of her purification is over.

5.verse: But if she gives birth to a girl, she will be unclean for two weeks, as in her niddah; and she is to wait another sixty-six days to be purified from her blood.

6.verse: “‘When the days of her purification are over, whether for a son or for a daughter, she is to bring a lamb in its first year for a burnt offering and a young pigeon or dove for a sin offering to the entrance of the tent of meeting, to the cohen.

7.verse: He will offer it before ADONAI and make atonement for her; thus she will be purified from her discharge of blood. Such is the law for a woman who gives birth, whether to a boy or to a girl.

8.verse: If she can’t afford a lamb, she is to take two doves or two young pigeons, the one for a burnt offering and the other for a sin offering; the cohen will make atonement for her, and she will be clean.’”

1.verse: ADONAI said to Moshe and Aharon,

2.verse: “If someone develops on his skin a swelling, scab or bright spot which could develop into the disease tzara‘at, he is to be brought to Aharon the cohen or to one of his sons who are cohanim.

3.verse: The cohen is to examine the sore on his skin; if the hair in the sore has turned white, and the sore appears to go deep into the skin, it is tzara‘at, and after examining him the cohen is to declare him unclean.

4.verse: If the bright spot on his skin is white, but it does not appear to go deep into the skin, and its hair has not turned white, then the cohen is to isolate him for seven days.

5.verse: On the seventh day the cohen is to examine him again, and if the sore appears the same as before and has not spread on the skin, then the cohen is to isolate him for seven more days.

6.verse: (LY: ii) On the seventh day the cohen is to examine him again, and if the sore has faded and hasn’t spread on the skin, then the cohen is to declare him clean — it is only a scab, so he is to wash his clothes and be clean.

7.verse: But if the scab spreads further on the skin after he has been examined by the cohen and declared clean, he is to let himself be examined yet again by the cohen.

8.verse: The cohen will examine him, and if he sees that the scab has spread on his skin, then the cohen will declare him unclean; it is tzara‘at.

9.verse: “If a person has tzara‘at, he is to be brought to the cohen.

10.verse: The cohen is to examine him, and if he sees that there is a white swelling in the skin which has turned the hair white and inflamed flesh in the swelling,

11.verse: then it is chronic tzara‘at on his skin, and the cohen is to declare him unclean; he is not to isolate him, because it is already clear that he is unclean.

12.verse: If the tzara‘at breaks out all over the skin, so that, as far as the cohen can see, the person with tzara‘at has sores everywhere on his body, from his head to his feet;

13.verse: then the cohen is to examine him, and if he sees that the tzara‘at has covered his entire body, he is to pronounce the person with the sores clean — it has all turned white, and he is clean.

14.verse: But if one day inflamed flesh appears on him, he will be unclean.

15.verse: The cohen will examine the inflamed flesh and declare him unclean; the inflamed flesh is unclean; it is tzara‘at.

16.verse: However, if the inflamed flesh again turns white, he is to come to the cohen.

17.verse: The cohen will examine him, and if he sees that the sores have turned white, then the cohen is to declare clean the person with the sores; he is clean.

18.verse: (LY: iii) “If a person has on his skin a boil that heals

19.verse: in such a way that in place of the boil there is a white swelling or a reddish-white bright spot, it is to be shown to the cohen.

20.verse: The cohen is to examine it; if he sees that it appears to be more than skin-deep, and its hair has turned white, then the cohen is to pronounce him unclean — the disease of tzara‘at has broken out in the boil.

21.verse: But if the cohen looks at it and doesn’t see any white hairs in it, and it isn’t more than skin-deep but appears faded, the cohen is to isolate him for seven days.

22.verse: If it spreads on the skin, the cohen is to declare him unclean; it is the disease.

23.verse: But if the bright spot stays where it was and has not spread, it is the scar of the boil; and the cohen is to declare him clean.

24.verse: (RY: ii, LY: iv) “Or if someone has on his skin a burn caused by fire; and the inflamed flesh where it was burned has become a bright spot, reddish-white or white,

25.verse: then the cohen is to examine it; and if he sees that the hair in the bright spot has turned white and that it appears to be deeper than the skin around it, it is tzara‘at; it has broken out in the burn, and the cohen is to declare him unclean; it is a sore from tzara‘at.

26.verse: But if the cohen examines it and sees no white hair in the bright spot, and it is no lower than the skin around it but looks faded, then the cohen is to isolate him for seven days.

27.verse: On the seventh day the cohen is to examine him; if it has spread on the skin, then the cohen is to declare him unclean; it is a sore from tzara‘at.

28.verse: But if the bright spot stays where it was and has not spread on the skin but appears faded, it is a swelling due to the burn; and the cohen is to declare him clean; because it is only a scar from the burn.

29.verse: (LY: v) “If a man or woman has a sore on the head or a man in his beard,

30.verse: then the cohen is to examine the sore; if he sees that it appears to be deeper than the skin around it, with yellow, thin hair in it, then the cohen is to declare him unclean; it is a crusted area, a tzara‘at of the head or beard.

31.verse: If the cohen examines the diseased crusted area and sees that it appears not to be deeper than the skin around it, and without any black hair in it, then the cohen is to isolate for seven days the person with the diseased crusted area.

32.verse: On the seventh day the cohen is to examine the sore, and if he sees that the crusted area hasn’t spread, that it has no yellow hair in it, and that the crusted area is not deeper than the skin around it;

33.verse: then the person is to be shaved, except for the crusted area itself, and the cohen is to isolate him for seven more days.

34.verse: On the seventh day the cohen is to examine the crusted area; and if he sees that the crusted area has not spread on the skin and does not appear to be deeper than the skin around it, then the cohen is to declare him clean; he is to wash his clothes and be clean.

35.verse: But if the crusted area spreads after his purification,

36.verse: then the cohen is to examine him; and if he sees that the crusted area has spread on the skin, the cohen is not to look for yellow hair; he is unclean.

37.verse: But if the crusted area’s appearance doesn’t change, and black hair grows up in it, then the crusted area is healed; he is clean; and the cohen is to declare him clean.

38.verse: (RY: iii, LY: vi) “If a man or woman has bright spots on his skin, bright white spots;

39.verse: then the cohen is to examine them. If he sees that the bright spots on the skin are dull white, it is only a rash that has broken out on the skin; he is clean.

40.verse: “If a man’s hair has fallen from his scalp, he is bald; but he is clean.

41.verse: If his hair has fallen off the front part of his head, he is forehead-bald; but he is clean.

42.verse: But if on the bald scalp or forehead there is a reddish-white sore, it is tzara‘at breaking out on his bald scalp or forehead.

43.verse: Then the cohen is to examine him; if he sees that there is a reddish-white swelling on his bald scalp or forehead, appearing like tzara‘at on the rest of the body,

44.verse: he is a person with tzara‘at; he is unclean; the cohen must declare him unclean; the sore is on his head.

45.verse: “Everyone who has tzara‘at sores is to wear torn clothes and unbound hair, cover his upper lip and cry, ‘Unclean! Unclean!’

46.verse: As long as he has sores, he will be unclean; since he is unclean, he must live in isolation; he must live outside the camp.

47.verse: “When tzara‘at infects an article of clothing, whether it be a woolen or a linen garment,

48.verse: on the threads or the woven-in parts of either linen or wool, or on a hide or item made of leather;

49.verse: then if the stain on the garment, hide, threads, woven-in parts or leather item is greenish or reddish, it is an infection of tzara‘at and is to be shown to the cohen.

50.verse: The cohen is to examine the stain and isolate the article that has the infection for seven days.

51.verse: On the seventh day he is to examine the stain; if the stain has spread on the garment, threads, woven-in parts or leather, whatever its use, the infection is a contagious tzara‘at; the garment is unclean.

52.verse: He is to burn the garment, threads, woven-in parts of either wool or linen, or item of leather having the infection; for it is a contagious tzara‘at; it must be burned up completely.

53.verse: But if, when the cohen examines it, he sees that the infection has not spread on the garment or in the threads, woven-in parts or leather item,

54.verse: then the cohen is to order that the article having the infection be washed and isolated for seven more days.

55.verse: (RY: iv, LY: vii) The cohen is to examine it after the stain has been washed, and if he sees that the stain has not changed color, then, even though the stain has not spread, it is unclean; you are to burn it up completely — it is rotten, no matter whether the spot is on the outside or on the inside.

56.verse: If the cohen examines it and sees that the stain has faded after being washed, then he is to tear the stain out of the garment, leather, threads or woven-in parts.

57.verse: (LY: Maftir) If it appears again in the garment, threads, woven-in parts or leather item, it is contagious, and you are to burn up completely the article that had the stain.

58.verse: But if the infection is gone from the garment, threads, woven-in parts or leather item that you washed, then it is to be washed a second time, and it will be clean.

59.verse: This is the law concerning infections of tzara‘at in a garment of wool or linen, or in the threads or the woven-in parts, or in any leather item — when to declare it clean and when to declare it unclean. Haftarah Tazria: M’lakhim Bet (2 Kings) 4:42–5:19 B’rit Hadashah suggested readings for Parashah Tazria: Mattityahu (Matthew) 8:1–4, 11:2–6; Mark 1:40–45; Luke 2:22–24; 5:12–16; 7:18–23

1.verse: Parashah 28: M’tzora (Person afflicted with tzara‘at) 14:1–15:33 -[In regular years read with Parashah 27, in leap years read separately] ADONAI said to Moshe,

2.verse: “This is to be the law concerning the person afflicted with tzara‘at on the day of his purification. He is to be brought to the cohen,

3.verse: and the cohen is to go outside the camp and examine him there. If he sees that the tzara‘at sores have been healed in the afflicted person,

4.verse: then the cohen will order that two living clean birds be taken for the one to be purified, along with cedar-wood, scarlet yarn and hyssop leaves.

5.verse: The cohen is to order one of the birds slaughtered in a clay pot over running water.

6.verse: As for the live bird, he is to take it with the cedar-wood, scarlet yarn and hyssop and dip them and the living bird in the blood of the bird slaughtered over running water,

7.verse: and sprinkle the person to be purified from the tzara‘at seven times. Next he is to set the live bird free in an open field.

8.verse: He who is to be purified must wash his clothes, shave off all his hair and bathe himself in water. Then he will be clean; and after that, he may enter the camp; but he must live outside his tent for seven days.

9.verse: On the seventh day he is to shave all the hair off his head, also his beard and eyebrows — he must shave off all his hair; and he is to wash his clothes and bathe his body in water; and he will be clean.

10.verse: “On the eighth day he is to take two male lambs without defect, one female lamb in its first year without defect and six-and-a-half quarts of fine flour for a grain offering, mixed with olive oil, and two-thirds of a pint of olive oil.

11.verse: The cohen purifying him is to place the person being purified with these items before ADONAI at the entrance to the tent of meeting.

12.verse: The cohen is to take one of the male lambs and offer it as a guilt offering with the two-thirds-pint of olive oil, then wave them as a wave offering before ADONAI.

13.verse: (LY: ii) He is to slaughter the male lamb at the place in the sanctuary for slaughtering sin offerings and burnt offerings, because the guilt offering belongs to the cohen, just like the sin offering; it is especially holy.

14.verse: The cohen is to take some of the blood of the guilt offering and put it on the tip of the right ear of the person being purified, on the thumb of his right hand and on the big toe of his right foot.

15.verse: Next, the cohen is to take some of the two-thirds-pint of olive oil and pour it into the palm of his own left hand,

16.verse: dip his right finger in the oil that is in his left hand and sprinkle from the oil with his finger seven times before ADONAI.

17.verse: Then the cohen is to put some of the remaining oil in his hand on the tip of the right ear of the person being purified, on the thumb of his right hand, on the big toe of his right foot and on the blood of the guilt offering.

18.verse: Finally, the cohen is to put the rest of the oil in his hand on the head of the person being purified; and the cohen will make atonement for him before ADONAI.

19.verse: The cohen is to offer the sin offering and make atonement for the person being purified because of his uncleanness; afterwards, he is to slaughter the burnt offering.

20.verse: The cohen is to offer the burnt offering and the grain offering on the altar; thus the cohen will make atonement for him; and he will be clean.

21.verse: (RY: v, LY: iii) “If he is poor, so that he can’t afford to do otherwise, he is to take one male lamb as a guilt offering to be waved, to make atonement for him; two quarts of fine flour mixed with olive oil for a grain offering; two-thirds of a pint of olive oil;

22.verse: and two doves or two young pigeons, such as he can afford, the one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering.

23.verse: On the eighth day, he will bring them to the cohen for his purification, to the entrance of the tent of meeting before ADONAI.

24.verse: The cohen is to take the lamb of the guilt offering and the two-thirds of a pint of olive oil and wave them as a wave offering before ADONAI.

25.verse: He is to slaughter the lamb of the guilt offering; and the cohen is to take some of the blood of the guilt offering and put it on the tip of the right ear of the person being purified, on the thumb of his right hand and on the big toe of his right foot.

26.verse: The cohen is to take some of the olive oil and pour it into the palm of his own left hand,

27.verse: and sprinkle with his right hand some of the oil that is in his left hand seven times before ADONAI.

28.verse: The cohen is to put some of the oil in his hand on the tip of the right ear of the person being purified, on the thumb of his right hand, on the big toe of his right foot — in the same place as the blood of the guilt offering.

29.verse: Finally, the cohen is to put the rest of the oil in his hand on the head of the person being purified, to make atonement for him before ADONAI.

30.verse: He is to offer one of the doves or young pigeons, such as the person can afford,

31.verse: whatever his means suffice for — the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering — with the grain offering; thus the cohen will make atonement before ADONAI for the person being purified.

32.verse: Such is the law for the person who has tzara‘at sores if he cannot afford the usual elements used for his purification.”

33.verse: (RY: vi, LY: iv) ADONAI said to Moshe and Aharon,

34.verse: “When you have entered the land of Kena‘an which I am giving you as a possession, and I put an infection of tzara‘at in a house in the land that you possess,

35.verse: then the owner of the house is to come and tell the cohen, ‘It seems to me that there may be an infection in the house.’

36.verse: The cohen is to order the house emptied before he goes in to inspect the infection, so that everything in the house won’t be made unclean; afterwards, the cohen is to enter and inspect the house.

37.verse: He will examine the infection; and if he sees that the infection is in the walls of the house, with greenish or reddish depressions that seem to go in deeper than the surface of the wall,

38.verse: he is to go out of the house to its door and seal up the house for seven days.

39.verse: The cohen will come again on the seventh day and examine the house; if he sees that the infection has spread over its walls,

40.verse: he is to order them to remove the infected stones and throw them into some unclean place outside the city.

41.verse: Next, he is to have the inside of the house thoroughly scraped, and the scraped-off plaster is to be discarded outside the city in an unclean place.

42.verse: Finally, other stones must be set in the place of the first stones and other plaster used to replaster the house.

43.verse: If the infection returns and breaks out in the house after the stones have been removed and the house scraped and plastered;

44.verse: then the cohen is to enter and examine it. If he sees that the infection has spread in the house, it is a contagious tzara‘at in the house; it is unclean.

45.verse: He must break down the house and take its stones, timber and plaster out of the city to an unclean place.

46.verse: Moreover, whoever enters the house at any time while it is sealed up will be unclean until evening.

47.verse: Whoever lies down or eats in the house must wash his clothes.

48.verse: If the cohen enters, examines and sees that the infection has not spread in the house since it was plastered; then he is to declare the house clean; because the infection is cured.

49.verse: “To purify the house, he is to take two birds, cedar-wood, scarlet yarn and hyssop leaves.

50.verse: He is to slaughter one of the birds in a clay pot over running water.

51.verse: He is to take the cedar-wood, the hyssop, the scarlet yarn and the live bird and dip them in the blood of the slaughtered bird and in the running water, and sprinkle the house seven times.

52.verse: He will purify the house with the blood of the bird, the running water, the live bird, the cedar-wood, the hyssop and the scarlet yarn.

53.verse: But he is to set the live bird free outside the city in an open field; thus will he make atonement for the house; and it will be clean.

54.verse: (LY: v) “Such is the law for all kinds of tzara‘at sores, for a crusted area,

55.verse: for tzara‘at in a garment, for a house,

56.verse: for a swelling, for a scab and for a bright spot,

57.verse: to determine when it is clean and when it is unclean. This is the law concerning tzara‘at.”

1.verse: ADONAI said to Moshe and Aharon,

2.verse: “Tell the people of Isra’el, ‘When any man has a discharge from his body, the discharge is unclean.

3.verse: The discharge is unclean no matter whether it continues flowing or has stopped; it is still his uncleanness.

4.verse: Every bed which the person with the discharge lies on is unclean, and everything he sits on is unclean.

5.verse: Whoever touches his bed is to wash his clothes and bathe himself in water; he will be unclean until evening.

6.verse: Whoever sits on anything the person with the discharge sat on is to wash his clothes and bathe himself in water; he will be unclean until evening.

7.verse: Anyone who touches the body of the person with the discharge is to wash his clothes and bathe himself in water; he will be unclean until evening.

8.verse: If the person with the discharge spits on someone who is clean, the latter is to wash his clothes and bathe himself in water; he will be unclean until evening.

9.verse: Any saddle that the person with the discharge rides on will be unclean.

10.verse: Whoever touches anything that was under him will be unclean until evening; he who carries those things is to wash his clothes and bathe himself in water; he will be unclean until evening.

11.verse: If the person with the discharge fails to rinse his hands in water before touching someone, that person is to wash his clothes and bathe himself in water; he will be unclean until evening.

12.verse: If the person with the discharge touches a clay pot, it must be broken; if he touches a wooden utensil, it must be rinsed in water.

13.verse: “‘When a person with a discharge has become free of it, he is to count seven days for his purification. Then he is to wash his clothes and bathe his body in running water; after that, he will be clean.

14.verse: On the eighth day, he is to take for himself two doves or two young pigeons, come before ADONAI to the entrance of the tent of meeting and give them to the cohen.

15.verse: The cohen is to offer them, the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering; thus the cohen will make atonement for him on account of his discharge before ADONAI.

16.verse: (RY: vii, LY: vi) “‘If a man has a seminal emission, he is to bathe his entire body in water; he will be unclean until evening.

17.verse: Any clothing or leather on which there is any semen is to be washed with water; it will be unclean until evening.

18.verse: If a man goes to bed with a woman and has sexual relations, both are to bathe themselves in water; they will be unclean until evening.

19.verse: “‘If a woman has a discharge, and the discharge from her body is blood, she will be in her state of niddah for seven days. Whoever touches her will be unclean until evening.

20.verse: Everything she lies on or sits on in her state of niddah will be unclean.

21.verse: Whoever touches her bed is to wash his clothes and bathe himself in water; he will be unclean until evening.

22.verse: Whoever touches anything she sits on is to wash his clothes and bathe himself in water; he will be unclean until evening.

23.verse: Whether he is on the bed or on something she sits on, when he touches it, he will be unclean until evening.

24.verse: If a man goes to bed with her, and her menstrual flow touches him, he will be unclean seven days; and every bed he lies on will be unclean.

25.verse: “‘If a woman has a discharge of blood for many days not during her period, or if her discharge lasts beyond the normal end of her period, then throughout the time she is having an unclean discharge she will be as when she is in niddah — she is unclean.

26.verse: Every bed she lies on at any time while she is having her discharge will be for her like the bed she uses during her time of niddah; and everything she sits on will be unclean with uncleanness like that of her time of niddah.

27.verse: Whoever touches those things will be unclean; he is to wash his clothes and bathe himself in water; he will be unclean until evening.

28.verse: “‘If she has become free of her discharge, she is to count seven days; after that, she will be clean.

29.verse: (LY: vii) On the eighth day, she is to take for herself two doves or two young pigeons and bring them to the cohen at the entrance to the tent of meeting.

30.verse: The cohen is to offer the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering; thus the cohen will make atonement for her before ADONAI on account of her unclean discharge.

31.verse: (Maftir) “‘In this way you will separate the people of Isra’el from their uncleanness, so that they will not die in a state of uncleanness for defiling my tabernacle which is there with them.

32.verse: “‘Such is the law for the person who has a discharge; for the man who has a seminal emission that makes him unclean;

33.verse: for the woman in niddah during her menstrual period; for the person, man or woman, with a discharge; and for the man who has sexual relations with a woman who is unclean.
